message.content: We refer to Mayo Clinic's website about Vitamin D for help. Cholecalciferol, also known as vitamin D3, is produced when sunlight hits the skin and causes the conversion of 7-dehydrocholesterol to vitamin D3. Ergocalciferol, or vitamin D2, is obtained from dietary sources and supplements, but is also converted to the active form of vitamin D in the body. 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D is the active form of vitamin D that is produced in the kidneys, but does not require sunlight for its formation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Cholecalciferol (D3) requires sunlight for its synthesis in the skin, while the other options can be obtained through diet or supplements. Vitamin D is activated by the liver and kidneys into 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Vitamin D3 (cholecalciferol) is produced in the skin when 7-dehydrocholesterol is exposed to UVB rays from the sun, unlike the other options. Ergocalciferol (D2) is obtained from diet and supplements, and 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D is produced in the liver and kidneys from vitamin D precursors. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) cholecalciferol.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Cholecalciferol (D3) is synthesized from 7-dehydrocholestrol in response to UVB radiation. Ergocalciferol (D2) is obtained from plant sources and is converted to 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D in the liver and kidneys. 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D is the active form of vitamin D and is not formed directly from sunlight or dietary sources, but rather through conversion in the liver and kidneys. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) Cholecalciferol (D3).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Cholecalciferol, also known as vitamin D3, is synthesized in the skin when exposed to sunlight. 7-dehydrocholestrol is a precursor of vitamin D3, but it needs sunlight to further convert to vitamin D3. Ergocalciferol (D2) is a form of vitamin D that comes from plants and can be obtained through diet or supplements, while 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D is the active form of vitamin D that is produced through metabolic processes in the liver and kidney.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Cholecalciferol (D3) is the form of vitamin D that is created in the skin through sun exposure. The other options are either obtained through diet or further processing of vitamin D within the body.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Cholecalciferol, also known as Vitamin D3, is formed when 7-dehydrocholesterol in the skin is exposed to UVB radiation from sunlight. Ergocalciferol, or Vitamin D2, is obtained from dietary sources such as fungi and plants. 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D is the active form of vitamin D and is formed in the kidneys from Vitamin D3 or D2.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Cholecalciferol (D3) is formed in the skin upon exposure to sunlight, specifically UVB radiation. The others are either obtained from diet or are formed through chemical processes in the body.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Cholecalciferol, also known as vitamin D3, is created by the body when the skin is exposed to sunlight. The other options do not require sunlight for their formation. 7-dehydrocholesterol is converted to cholecalciferol by sunlight. Ergocalciferol, also known as vitamin D2, can be obtained from dietary sources, but is not formed by sunlight. 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D is the active form of vitamin D and is formed in the kidneys.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Cholecalciferol (D3) is synthesized in the skin upon exposure to ultraviolet-B (UVB) radiation from sunlight. The other options are either obtained from diet or produced in the liver or kidneys.
